result.execSummary:
The defendant Travon D Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other sentence/count. With 15 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
*Provide a DNA sample.
*Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
*All applicable fees of supervision.
*Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
*Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

*No alcohol, no drugs.
*No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
*Upon successful completion of probation (including financial obligations) Court will allow for expungement as to Count 1 ONLY.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
*Absolute/maintain sobriety.
*Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: *With Huber and Day Reporting Center. Court stayed commencement until 07/08/2016 by 5pm.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other sentence, with 15 days credit.

*Count 1 conditions apply except for condition time and expunction.
*Court allows for dosage probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travon D Hawkins

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original TRANSCRIPT OF PROCEEDINGS Transcript (21 pages) commencing 06-29-2016 by LISA WENINGER.
Converted to e-filing at request of Court Reporter Lisa Weninger.
Upon successful completion of probation (including financial obligations) Court will allow for expungement as to Count 1 ONLY.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  Court allows for dosage probation.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 15 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.   Court allows for dosage probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time with Huber and Day Reporting Center. Court stayed commencement until 07/08/2016 by 5pm. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

  Upon successful completion of probation (including financial obligations) Court will allow for expungement as to Count 1 only.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Sentence Referral Form 
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Received and Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Court also addresses Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Zachary A Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed telephone call.  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant has new charges (16CF628).  Court will address at next court date.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Francisco Araiza for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case in court for scheduling conference, defense attorney is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

16RM002195  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/14/2016
Cash Bail amended to $250.  Same Bail Condition.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $250.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Travon D Hawkins in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Travon D Hawkins in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Travon D Hawkins in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty to misdemeanor count.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
